rogel.io.fopl.formulas.operators

Class AbstractOperator

  • java.lang.Object
    • rogel.io.fopl.formulas.Formula
      • rogel.io.fopl.formulas.operators.AbstractOperator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Expression
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AndOperator, NotOperator, OrOperator

    public abstract class AbstractOperator
extends Formula
    An AbstractOperator is a Formula whose value is defined by the type of operator the class describes. There are three types of operators:
    1. conjunction (the 'and' connective)
    2. disjunction (the 'or' connective)
    3. negation (the 'not' connective)
    Author:
    recardona

      • getOperatorHead

        public final Formula getOperatorHead()
        Gets the operand Formula at the head of the list of operands. This method is equivalent to calling this.getOperand(0).
        Returns:
        the operand Formula at index 0.

      • getOperatorTail

        public abstract AbstractOperator getOperatorTail()
        Constructs a new operator applied to this.operandCount() - 1 operands: the operands obtained by removing the operand Formula returned by this.getOperatorHead().
        Returns:
        a new operator applied to the tail of this operator, or null if no tail can exist.

      • isAtomic

        public final boolean isAtomic()
        Returns true if and only if this Formula is atomic. Because Formulae that have operators applied to them are never atomic, this method always returns false.
        Specified by:
        isAtomic in class Formula
        Returns:
        false, always.

      • isLiteral

        public boolean isLiteral()
        Description copied from class: Formula
        Returns true if and only if this Formula is a literal. A literal is defined to be an atomic Formula or its negation.
        Specified by:
        isLiteral in class Formula
        Returns:
        true if this Formula is atomic or is the negation of an atomic Formula, false otherwise.

      • toString

        public final java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of this operator, which is a Lisp-style String of the form (operator_symbol operand1 operand2 ...).
        Overrides:

        Returns:
        a String representation of this operator.
